title: Conference Classics, Volume 3
description: Webster's Dictionary defines classic as "a work of enduring excellence." In this book readers will find six chapters of enduring excellence, taken from the speeches of Thomas S. Monson, a member of the Church's First Presidency. Each chapter is illustrated with examples from the scriptures and from the observations and experiences of this beloved apostle.Conference Classics, provides a message of hope, of love, of comfort, of concern, of joy. It is a series for readers of all ages and interests. It is a work of enduring excellence.
author: Thomas S. Monson
